sub_title: I love to keep learning and growing
summary:
I am a social science researcher with extensive experience in quantitative and qualitative research methods interested in the provision of evidence based research, evaluation and consultancy services. I am passionate about improving the life chances of disadvantaged children, young people and families. 
My other passion lies with Acceptance & Commitment Therapy (ACT) which has a significant influence in my personal and professional life. Its fundamental goal is to create psychological flexibility in the service of creating a meaningful life. 

I have worked with, advised and provided training to a number of high-profile organisations including the Dartington Social Research Unit, IMPETUS Private Equity Fund, YMCA Scotland, Financial Inclusion Forum UK, Hertie School of Governance, Ecorys, London School of Economics (LSE), Centre for the Analysis of Social Exclusion (CASE), Overseas Development Institute (ODI), Chronic Poverty Research Centre (CPRC) and German Development Agency (GIZ). 

Specialties: Research (qualitative & quantitative), Programme and Impact Evaluation, Evidence-based-programmes for children and families, Acceptance & Commitment Therapy (ACT)

Countries of work/research experience: Netherlands, United Kingdom, Germany, France, Belgium, Indonesia, India, Russia.
